Name: Multi-Domain Task Battery (MDTB)
HowToAcknowledge:
Please cite the following reference if you use these data: 
King, M., Hernandez-Castillo, C.R., Poldrack, R.A., Ivry, R.B., and Diedrichsen, J. (2019). Functional boundaries in the human cerebellum revealed by a multi-domain task battery. Nat. Neurosci. 22, 1371–1378.
Funding: This work was supported by the James S. McDonnell Foundation (Scholar award to J.D.), the Canadian Institutes of Health Research (PJT 159520 to J.D.), a Platform Support Grant from Brain Canada and the Canada First Research Excellence Fund (BrainsCAN to Western University), the National Science Foundation (OAC-1649658 to R.P.), and the National Institute of Health (NS092079, NS105839 to R.B.I.).
ReferencesAndLinks: For contrast maps of the cerebellum, see http://www.diedrichsenlab.org/imaging/mdtb.htm
